intro: Clidemia pilosissima, commonly known as the hairy mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, showy flowers. The plant attaches itself to host trees, drawing water and nutrients through its specialized roots. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a velvety texture. Clidemia pilosissima plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
